advertiserIdHeader.description: The identifier that describe DSP advertiser level accounts that exists under a manager account (previously under a DSP entity). Exposed in the /dsp/advertisers API.
advertiserIdHeader.name: Amazon-Ads-AccountId

clientHeader.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
clientHeader.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

profileHeader.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header and choose profile id `profileId` from the response to pass it as input.
profileHeader.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

AdTypeV1.description: Supported values are DSP(Demand Side Platform).

AssetV1M2.description: The Amazon Creative Asset Library asset identifier. Refer https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/creative-asset-library

AudienceGroupV1M2.description: The model for holding Audiece selection within a group. The expression within an audience group will be evaluated using the IntraGroupOperator. The InterGroupOperator will be applied on the output of one audience group with another audience group.

audienceSegments.description: List of audience segments in this group.

AudienceResearchStudyResultV1M2.description: The result of Audience Research study.

surveyResponses.description: Detailed response rate for each response in Survey question aggregated by different segments.

totalResponses.description: Total number of responses received in the Survey.

AudienceSegmentV1M2.description: The model for holding an Audience Segment.

segmentId.description: ID for the audience segment. This ID can be fetched from these APIs- https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/audiences/#/Discovery

AudienceSelectionOperatorV1M2.description: The operator used in Audience Segment Selection to determine which operation needs to be applied across selected segments. AND operator takes priority over OR operator.

AudienceTargetingGroupV1M2.description: The model for holding Audiece targeting group. The includedAudienceGroups and excludedAudienceGroups are always joined with AND operator.

excludedAudienceGroups.description: List of audience groups to be excluded from the targeted audience.

includedAudienceGroups.description: List of audience groups to be included in the targeted audience.

fundingTypeFilters.description: FundingType filters to be applied when checking eligibility status. If not supplied we will check against all available vendor products.

vendorProductIdFilters.description: VendorProduct identifier filters to be applied when checking eligibility status. If not supplied we will check against all available vendor products.

vendorTypeFilters.description: VendorType filters to be applied when checking eligibility status. If not supplied we will check against all available vendor products.

comment.description: The approver's comment on why the study is approved/rejected.

createDate.description: The study creation date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC.

endDate.description: The study end date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC. By default this will be the latest endDate of the associated orders.

externalReferenceId.description: Optional field. For some vendors, advertisers are required to provide this vendor assigned reference identifier for EXTERNAL_BILLING studies.

id.description: The study canonical identifier. Immutable field. This is required for update.

lastUpdatedDate.description: The study last updated date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC.

rejectionReasons.description: List of reasons for rejection, this will only be available if the status is REJECTED. This field is deprecated, use statusReasons instead.

reviewDate.description: The study review date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC.

startDate.description: The study start date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC. By default this will be the earliest startDate of the associated orders.

statusReasons.description: List of reasons for study status. For example, when study is marked Rejected or Ineligible, this field would be available.

studyResultStatus.description: The status of result of the study.

comment.description: The approver's comment on why the study is approved/rejected.

DSPAudienceResearchMetadataV1M2.description: The basic model for all DSP AUDIENCE_RESEARCH objective studies.

peerNames.description: A list of peer names for the study brand.

id.description: The study canonical identifier. Immutable field.

currentStudyId.description: Optional current study identifier, if provided orders are expected to be added into this study and the orders already associated with this study will be excluded from certain eligibility check.

excludedLineItemIds.description: A list of canonical lineItem identifiers that are excluded from the eligibility check.

orderIds.description: A list of canonical order identifiers. By default all lineItems in those orders will be included.

peerNames.description: A list of peer names for the study brand.

verb.description: The verb that will be used in the applicable survey questions to construct the question text.

advertiserId.description: The associated advertiser identifier. Immutable field.

excludedLineItemIds.description: A list of canonical lineItem identifiers that are excluded from the study.

assets.description: A list of assets to be used for the creative testing study as part of either the survey question or the response. In case of API responses, number of assets returned would be limited to 10 even if a creative testing study has more than 10 assets associated with it.

id.description: The study canonical identifier. Immutable field.

brandIds.description: A list of canonical brand identifiers.

currentStudyId.description: Optional current study identifier. If provided orders are expected to be added into this study and the orders already associated with this study will be excluded from certain eligibility checks.

excludedLineItemIds.description: A list of canonical lineItem identifiers that are excluded from the eligibility check.

orderIds.description: A list of canonical order identifiers. By default all lineItems in those orders will be included.

brandIds.description: A list of canonical brand ids to be tracked for off-Amazon conversions.

EligibilityFieldV1M2.description: Fields that will be checked as part of eligibility API call.

EligibilityIssueSeverityV1.description: Supported values are WARNING, ERROR. ERROR severity issues need to be resolved while WARNING severity issues can be ignored.

code.description: An enumerated issue code for machine use.

message.description: A human-readable description of the issue with suggestions on how to resolve the issue.

code.description: An enumerated issue code for machine use.

message.description: A human-readable description of the issue with suggestions on how to resolve the issue.

budget.description: The total budget. Expressed in dollars.

endDate.description: The latest end date of the associated orders in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC.

flightLength.description: The flight length of the associated orders. Expressed in days.

startDate.description: The earliest start date of associated orders in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC.

EligibilityStatusV1.description: Supported values are ELIGIBLE, INELIGIBLE and ELIGIBLE_WITH_WARNING. INELIGIBLE status indicates the study can not be created.

message.description: A human-readable description of the response.

requestId.description: Request Id that uniquely identifies your request.

FundingTypeV1.description: The measurement funding type. For COMPLIMENTARY studies the cost will be covered by Amazon.

MeasurementGoalV1.description: The measurement budget optimization goal type goal.

minimumBudget.description: The minimum budget. Expressed in dollars.

OmnichannelMetricsBrandSearchRequestV1M2.description: The request object to fetch brands to be used in the OMNICHANNEL_METRICS vendor product.

brandIdFilter.description: List of brandIds in the omnichannel metrics brand catalog. Either one of brandIdFilter or brandNameSearch should be provided.

brandNameSearch.description: Text to search for eligible brands in the omnichannel metrics brand catalog. Either one of brandIdFilter or brandNameSearch should be provided.

PaginatedDSPAudienceResearchStudiesV1M2.description: A list of audience research studies.

PaginatedDSPCreativeTestingStudiesV1M2.description: A list of creative testing studies.

totalResults.description: The total number of matched brands.

totalResults.description: The total number of vendor products.

PlanningEligibilityV1M3.description: The request object of measurement eligibility check.

issues.description: A list of issues will be provided if the status is INELIGIBLE or ELIGIBLE_WITH_WARNING.

rank.description: The lower the number, the more recommended the vendor product is.

budget.description: The total estimated budget of the order.

endDate.description: The estimated end date of the order in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC.

impressions.description: The total estimated impressions of the order.

startDate.description: The estimated start date of the order in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD). Timezone is UTC.

ResourceLinkV1M1.description: The link that can be used to access corresponding resources in advertising portal.

StudyObjectiveV1.description: Measurement category based on the purpose of the measurement.

code.description: An enumerated success or error code for machine use.

index.description: The index of the object in the request, starting from 1.

message.description: A human-readable message of the code.

requestId.description: Request Id that uniquely identifies your request.

StudyStatusV1.description: The study status. Only required if study is in DRAFT as part of study creation/update.

StudySubmissionTypeV1.description: The submission type for the creation and updating of studies. Currently, this submission type is supported for brand lift studies only.  This is an optional parameter in each of the request objects and its default value is `SUBMISSION` if not provided. A value of `SUBMISSION` indicates that a study should be submitted for approval. A value of `DRAFT` indicates that a study should be saved but not submitted.

SurveyQuestionCategoryRequirementV1M1.description: The requirement for specific survey question category.

maximumQuestions.description: The maximum number of questions required for the question category.

minimumQuestions.description: The minimum number of questions required for the question category.

SurveyQuestionGridQuestionResponseV1M1.description: The grid question response object. Only applicable for SINGLE_SELECT_GRID type question.

parentField.description: The field name that this range depends on. Will be empty if this range is the default range.

parentValue.description: The field value that this range depends on. Will be empty if this range is the default range.

parentField.description: The field name that this value list depends on. Will be empty if this is the default list.

parentValue.description: The field value that this value list depend on. Will be empty if this is the default list.

SurveyQuestionPlaceholderCandidateV1.description: The placeholder candidate in Survey question.

allowCustomValue.description: Whether custom value is allowed for the placeholder.

allowedValueRanges.description: Allowed value ranges for placeholder. Only applicable if the valueType is INTEGER.

allowedValues.description: Allowed values for placeholder. Will be empty if placeholder is free text field.

defaultValues.description: Default values that will be appended to the values list regardless.

fieldName.description: The survey question placeholder field name.

inferredFields.description: Where the placeholder values will be inferred from.

maximumValueLength.description: The maximum allowed character length for each individual placeholder value.

minimumValueLength.description: The minimum allowed character length for each individual placeholder value.

isQualifying.description: This is only required if the corresponding field is 'response', this will help to define if the response value will be counted as a positive one in the study report.

value.description: The survey question placeholder field value.

SurveyQuestionPlaceholderV1.description: The object specifying a placeholder in Survey question.

fieldName.description: The survey question placeholder field name.

fieldValues.description: The survey question placeholder field values.

SurveyQuestionResponseV1M2.description: The survey question response chosen by Survey audience.

responseValue.description: The response text if the question response type is TEXT.

SurveyQuestionSubCategoryV1M1.description: The survey question sub-category. Only applicable to certain categories

SurveyQuestionTemplateV1.description: Survey question template for vendor product.

id.description: The survey question template canonical Id.

maximumQualifyingResponses.description: The maximum number of qualifying responses allowed for the question. This will be available if the qualifying responses are not pre-defined/inferred.

maximumQuestionResponses.description: The maximum number of responses allowed for the question. This will be available if the question responses are not pre-defined/inferred.

minimumQualifyingResponses.description: The minimum number of qualifying responses required for the question. This will be available if the qualifying responses are not pre-defined/inferred.

minimumQuestionResponses.description: The minimum number of responses required for the question. This will be available if the question responses are not pre-defined/inferred.

qualifyingResponses.description: The pre-defined qualifying survey question responses with placeholders, this will help to define which responses will be counted as positive ones in the study report.

questionResponses.description: The pre-defined survey question responses with placeholders.

questionText.description: The survey question text with placeholders.

id.description: The survey question template canonical Id.

maximumQualifyingResponses.description: The maximum number of qualifying responses allowed for the question. This will be available if the qualifying responses are not pre-defined/inferred.

maximumQuestionResponses.description: The maximum number of responses allowed for the question. This will be available if the question responses are not pre-defined/inferred.

minimumQualifyingResponses.description: The minimum number of qualifying responses required for the question. This will be available if the qualifying responses are not pre-defined/inferred.

minimumQuestionResponses.description: The minimum number of responses required for the question. This will be available if the question responses are not pre-defined/inferred.

priority.description: The priority of the question. If present this will determine the ordering of questions in a survey. The check will be enforced when a survey is created/updated. Lower number indicates higher priority.

qualifyingResponses.description: The pre-defined qualifying survey question responses with placeholders, this will help to define which responses will be counted as positive ones in the study report.

questionResponses.description: The pre-defined survey question responses with placeholders.

questionText.description: The survey question text with placeholders.

SurveyQuestionTypeV1.description: The survey question type. SINGLE_SELECT question will allow customers to choose only one response, MULTI_SELECT question will allow customers to choose multiple responses, RATING will allow customers to choose a rating on a scale (e.g. 1 to 5), FREE_TEXT will allow customers to provide a free formed question text, SINGLE_ASSET_SELECT will allow customers to choose an asset as the response.

SurveyQuestionTypeV1M1.description: The survey question type. SINGLE_SELECT question will allow customers to choose only one response, MULTI_SELECT question will allow customers to choose multiple responses, RATING will allow customers to choose a rating on a scale (e.g. 1 to 5), FREE_TEXT will allow customers to provide a free formed question text.

SurveyResponseResultV1.description: The rate of response for each response in Survey question.

adExposedGroupResponseRate.description: The percent of people in ad exposed group choosing this response.

controlGroupResponseRate.description: The percent of people in control group choosing this response.

isQualifyingResponse.description: Is the response a qualifying response. Used in calculating Brand Lift.

marginOfError.description: The percentage of margin of error for this response.

questionResponse.description: The response choosen by Survey audience.

questionSequence.description: Sequence number of the question in the Survey.

responseRate.description: The percentage of people choosing this response.

segmentType.description: The segment type to which this response data belongs to.

segmentValue.description: The segment value to which this response data belongs to. Would be corresponding to the above segmentType field.

statisticalSignificance.description: The significance percentage for the response data in this segment.

externalReferenceIdRequired.description: Whether or not the vendor assigned external reference identifier is required for measurement setup.

vendorApprovalRequired.description: Whether or not the vendor requires an additional sign off process to fully qualify for study.

vendorTypeFilters.description: VendorType filters to be applied when fetching measurement vendor products. If not supplied we will include all available vendor products.

adTypeFilters.description: AdType filters to be applied when fetching measurement vendor products. If not supplied we will include all available vendor products.

fundingTypeFilters.description: FundingType filters to be applied when fetching measurement vendor products. If not supplied we will include all available vendor products.

objectiveTypeFilters.description: StudyObjective filters to be applied when fetching measurement vendor products. If not supplied we will include all available vendor products.

studyTypeFilters.description: StudyType filters to be applied when fetching measurement vendor products. If not supplied we will include all available vendor products.

vendorProductIdFilters.description: VendorProduct identifier filters to be applied when fetching measurement vendor products. If not supplied we will include all available vendor products.

vendorTypeFilters.description: VendorType filters to be applied when fetching measurement vendor products. If not supplied we will include all available vendor products.

VendorTypeV1.description: The measurement vendor type, each study type will have different supported vendors.

VendorTypeV1M1.description: The measurement vendor type, each study type will have different supported vendors.

VendorTypeV1M2.description: The measurement vendor type, each study type will have different supported vendors.

VendorTypeV1M3.description: The measurement vendor type, each study type will have different supported vendors.

The path expires after 60 seconds.

get.summary: Gets base study objects given a list of studyIds or a list of advertiserIds.

get.description:
Get result of a DSP BRAND_LIFT study. Returns 200 successful response if json resource is requested in Accept header. Returns a 307 Temporary Redirect response if any of the file types is requested and response includes a location header with the value set to an AWS S3 path where the result is located. The path expires after 60 seconds.

**Authorized resource type**:
DSP Rodeo Entity ID, DSP Advertiser Account ID

**Parameter name**:
Amazon-Ads-AccountId

**Parameter in**:
header

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["campaign_view"]

parameters.description: The version(s) of the requested resource. Available version(s) - `application/vnd.measurementresult.v1+json`, `application/vnd.measurementresult.v1.1+json`, `text/vnd.measurementresult.v1+csv`
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: The canonical identifier that represents a unique study.
parameters.name: studyId

307.description: Successful operation for downloading result file.

Location.description: Redirect URI with S3 file location containing result data.
